thread.title: TV | Ireland's Sulky Racers: Reality Bites
thread.title_full: TV | Ireland's Sulky Racers: Reality Bites - entertainment.ie

author: Fiona Flynn
title: TV | Ireland's Sulky Racers: Reality Bites
text: In case you, like us, thought sulkies were just something that were thrown by kids when they didn't get their way, turns out that they are in fact lightweight chariots pulled by a horse in races, and is quite the thing in Ireland would you believe. This documentary offers an insight into the fascinating sub-culture of sulky racers, meeting people who care deeply about their piebalds, and yet who race on the wild side - on Sundays at dawn and on roads blocked off to traffic. We meet owners and drivers based in Dublin, Meath, Clare and Limerick, who show the extremes they will go to in order to prepare their horses for race day.
